page.title: 14TRADITIONAL FOODS
page.content: Traditional Foods: The Pasty (Pastie) was originally a meal for Cornish tin miners. It consists of an oval-shaped pastry casing, folded and crimped together along one side, containing a savoury filling of diced meat, potatoes and onion. It is cooked in an oven and can be eaten hot or cold. The miners did not eat the pastry casing but, when opened, used it as a 'plate' to rest on the dirty rocks or floor of the mine.The original pasty might also be meat & sweet, with potatoe and meat at one end and apple at the other. Star Gazey Pie consists of herrings baked in a dish with a pastry lid and is served with the fish heads poking through the pastry. A Cornigh Cream Tea consists of scones (small cakes) spread with home-made jam and clotted cream (skimming from the top of boiled milk).
